info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 8:03AM CDT until May 30 at 3:53PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cottonwood River near Florence.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Friday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, minor flooding of the left bank and roads along the north bank will begin. At 24.0 feet, Outside the levee system in southeast Florence, flood waters flow across Park Ave Road and reach the foundation of a residential home. Northwest of Florence, the bridge on 140th Road and 1/2 mile west of Highway 77 floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 23.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON
